intro: Sirmuellera victoriae, commonly known as Victoria's sirmuellera, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentamerous flowers that typically display vibrant colors such as red or pink. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
